text:
90-98 Pierrepont Street, adjoining the southeast corner of Henry Street. The house on the right, No. 90, was occupied by the Terry family. The center house, no. 96, is the Turner house. For a view of the rears of these homes see 35-41 Montague Street

about 1916

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

Pierrepont Street, south side, west from Henry Street, showing from left to right from the second house, the home of the Rev. Richard Salter Storrs D.D. and the home of one Allen subsequently occupied by a Prof. West.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Pierrepoint Street, north side, east from No. 95, at Henry towards Fulton Streets, showing among other buildings, the Reformed Church-on-the-Heights, at No. 103, and the Unitarian Church of the Saviour, at No. 113.

June 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a close up of the "Church on the Heights" (Reformed). The Congregation of this church organized in 1837 and erected their first place of worship on Henry Street as the "Central Church" (Dutch Reformed) in 1839. They disbanded in 1841 and the remainder of the Congregation formed the above named church shortly thereafter and laid the corner stone at the present location in 1849.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)
Pierrepoint Street, north side, east from No. 95, at Henry towards Fulton Streets, showing among other buildings, the Reformed Church-on-the-Heights, at No. 103, and the Unitarian Church of the Saviour, at No. 113.

June 11, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a close up of the "Church on the Heights" (Reformed). The Congregation of this church organized in 1837 and erected their first place of worship on Henry Street as the "Central Church" (Dutch Reformed) in 1839. They disbanded in 1841 and the remainder of the Congregation formed the above named church shortly thereafter and laid the corner stone at the present location in 1849.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Pierrepoint Street, north side, west from Henry Street. (These homes were demolished in August 1923). 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Pierrepont Street, north side, from Henry to Fulton Streets. In the foreground, is the Reformed Church on the Heights, beyond the Church of the Saviour. (First Unitarian). 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(1)

95-111 Pierrepont Street, north side, west from Henry Street to Monroe Place. No. 111, the home of Dr. A. De Yoanna, is in the foreground, at the corner of Monroe Place. August 10, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, except that only the house in foreground of view No. 1 is shown.

August 10, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)

95-111 Pierrepont Street, north side, west from Henry Street to Monroe Place. No. 111, the home of Dr. A. De Yoanna, is in the foreground, at the corner of Monroe Place. August 10, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, except that only the house in foreground of view No. 1 is shown.

August 10, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
